intro: Achillea hybrida, commonly known as yarrow, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features finely divided, gray-green foliage. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Achillea hybrida is known for its hardiness and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
